website_summaries.verdict: We like the multi-prong approach K9 Advantix II uses against a broad spectrum of parasites and insects.
pros: Broad-spectrum formula, also addresses biting flies, lice and mosquitoes.Contains imidacloprid, permethrin and pyriproxyfen
Waterproof when dry, remains effective after baths
Starts to work in as little as 12 hours
cons: Does not work well as a flea or tick repellent
Frequent treatments may be required for best results

customer_reviews.title: Nearly killed my dog
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what exactly is wrong, but I notified Bayer, the manufacturer about this adverse effect. Bought a 6 pack, and he did fine with first 5 months. Sixth dose (always on first of month) he got lethargic, irritable, and partially paralyzed. Washed him immediately, and will never use again. I bought peppermint oil, and spray him with this diluted in water now. Never again ADVANTIX II
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Finlay

customer_reviews.title: We have been using it for a few months religiously as detailed on the package and it's useless. In the last week (9 days after application)
customer_reviews.text: It just simply doesn't work. We have been using it for a few months religiously as detailed on the package and it's useless. In the last week (9 days after application), we have found 2 fully engorged ticks on our dog and one that was just beginning to feed. We take him up to our cabin on the weekends and despite brushing him after going outside and avoiding problem areas, he consistently gets tickets. Its really expensive and just doesn't do anything at all.
customer_reviews.author: J. Flanagan

customer_reviews.title: It had been working amazing..
customer_reviews.text: I used this brand for almost 2 years because frontline stopped working. It had been working amazing... until this year. My whole house is now infested and my dogs get no relief. I would vacuum and wash everything in the house constantly and nothing would help. I'm so disappointed because I had so much faith in this product but that's gone now. I've recently switched to another brand and it helped for maybe a week and the fleas are back already. Fleas are relentless this year. But this product does nothing to fleas. It works great against ticks but that's not what I need it for.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney W.

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for the ohio 2018 flea season
customer_reviews.text: Neighbors animals who are around our dogs daily are covered in fleas. We medicated with this and they used another expensive name brand. Our dog is flea free theirs are covered. It's working great for the ohio 2018 flea season.
customer_reviews.author: superdano

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: product caused bloody raw sore and +$200 vet bill
customer_reviews.text: We bought this from another third party site, but wanted to write a review for people here to BEWARE. We bought this for our 45 pound English bulldog and it burned her skin. It was really raw and bloody. We had to take her to the vet and pay a couple hundred dollars for an evaluation, antibiotics, etc. The first 2 photos were taken 24-48 hours after we put the flea medication on her. The last photo was taken about a week later after the blood dried up and became a scab.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: I lived in Florida when I rescued my dog from the gutter he has really sensitive skin and would get really bad bald spots when he was bitten by fleas.. I was using another product at the time that was about the same price. When I started to use this no more bald spots because it really does repeal the fleas BEFORE they bite him... I now live in MA and we take walks in the woods so I am so thankful this also repeals the ticks also...It doesn't leave that greasy spot for days on end he has never had any side affects from it.
customer_reviews.author: debbie rusnak

customer_reviews.title: K9 Advantix really does work.
customer_reviews.text: Our little Schnauzer had a bad flea problem. We treated her & our yard, to no avail. Then I ordered K9 Advantix, applied it to her skin & in no time at all she was flea free. We have administered a monthly treatment now for 4 months & she stays flea free. I love K9 Advantix and wish I had tried it sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My experience
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Pomeranians and I've usually always bought frontline but this was significantly cheaper so I decided to give it a try. Yes it got rid of fleas but it contains a toxic chemical for dogs which enters their bloodstream and can be very harmful. It gave the one bigger in size seizures so no need to say I will never buy this again. Without this negative factor, overall it's a great product but I would rather buy something else and be safe than sorry. You can research this product and what it contains and as of the side effects to learn more.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: He seems fine now 12 hours after
customer_reviews.text: My dog acted very sickly and had about a 2-3 second seizure after about an hour of apply this.. He is a 28 lb, 10 year old dog. He seems fine now 12 hours after, but it was concerning for the first few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Wheat

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work and causes skin issues.
customer_reviews.text: First off, this product caused a strong skin reaction on my dog which gave her an open blister that seemed quite painful and took over a week to heal. Obviously, that may be an allergic reaction that your animal might not experience. What is worse, however, is the fact that this product doesn't work. Three weeks after application I found a large tick on my dog that had clearly been happily feeding for quite some time. Disappointed. We are throwing out the second dose and will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Moon mama

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS: Causes SEIZURES!
customer_reviews.text: My healthy 4-year old dog started to have seizures on a weekly basis 3 days as of when I applied this product to her for the first time! WARNING: The video is of my dog having her third seizure. I’ve never used this product before, only used it on one of my three dogs b/c it was quick to get via Amazon. Washing it off now & I will never use it again! I had to give the product 1 star to post my review or I couldn’t post & I had to share this info!
customer_reviews.author: Hildi

customer_reviews.title: Toxic
customer_reviews.text: This medication gave my dog a twitching ear reaction, I have worked grooming dogs for 10 years I know what an irritated or infected ear looks like his is twitching because of a reaction to this medication, hopefully it does not turn into a serious problem I gave him 3 baths to try to wash off the remaining medicine, he seems ok otherwise other than his ear bothering him, it started right after medication was applied. I would say avoid these medicines all together it’s much safer to us dawn dish soap every few weeks it completely kills fleas and is much safer for pets.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle

customer_reviews.title: My dogs are not happy
customer_reviews.text: I am on the fence about this product. My corgi's have had it on for 2 days now. The first day they both acted very lethargic and rolled over and over as if trying to remove it. Second day they are still not happy. We have used Bravecto for years and felt it was time to change. Reviews of this product lead to my purchase. I was hoping for favorable results but not too hopeful thinking about doing this to my babies every month.
customer_reviews.author: PAULETTE DARWAY

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about mosquitoes but when I took my dog to a park and we sat near a river near a grassy tree lined area I saw the swarm of mosquitoes hovering a few feet away but not going on or near my dog. That evening I checked the date and realized I was a week late on my second monthly application. No ticks at all either and I'm assuming this prevents everything else they say that it does. No skin irritation or side effects. I was worried about that because the breed I have is notorious for itchy skin and allergies. This is the only brand I will use now.
customer_reviews.author: GDmom

customer_reviews.title: Dosage too inexact!
customer_reviews.text: After years of using Frontline plus without any incidents I administered this product according to the directions. My 30 dog was sick within 2 hours, at that point I tried to wipe him down to get rid of the chemicals but damage was already done. I called the 800 number and spoke to a "vet tech" and she said that 1) dosage was not actually based on the weight but on dog's surface ( which made no sense to me) 2)it does not go into the dog's system but only on skin? It took my dog 5 days to bounce back. I have thrown out the rest of the package.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Almost KILLED MY DOG, vet said NO dog should be given this abomination.
customer_reviews.text: My poor little guy's been on IV fluids for 2 days thanks to this garbage and is just now coming back around. It's a crime that it's even being sold at all. Permethrin, one of the active ingredients, is highly toxic. PLEASE, if you love your pet, DO NOT USE THIS. Google and you'll see thousands of similar reactions from other pet owners. I wish I'd Googled instead of just trusting Amazon reviews. Never again. Please do not inflict this upon your loved ones. I'm extremely lucky to still have mine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 1 year now. I live in Texas, and we go out every day, and to the river sometimes. Never had a flea or tick. Like most drops it leaves an oily mark on the back, but if you spread it in multiple points (like you should anyways) the marks get cleaned in 3-4 days. The drop does not smell too bad also, which is great. I have never seen any side effects: no nausea, lethargy, or anything weird. Just bought a refill, and will keep using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: This product wasn't bad
customer_reviews.text: But I will explain why I can't give it five stars. It was easy to use and cheaper than buying it at the vet but my dog had a reaction to it. Within 24 hours she had severe diarrhea and her skin broke out into bumps. After a visit with the vet the advised giving chewables because they're less likely to cause such irritation to the skin. The product did what it was suppose to it kept her flea and tick clean for 30 days so I can't bash it completely. But, if you know your dog has allergies or is easily upset with skin irritations, I'd suggest a chewables.
customer_reviews.author: cory

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper isn't always better
customer_reviews.text: I usually use another top brand, but was trying to save money. Our dog has allergies to most things outdoors, so he's often itchy. We put the drops on him last month and figured he was scratching due to his allergies. Put them on this month, 7 days ago, hes scratching like crazy. I just looked him over really good and he's got a bunch of fleas. Cheaper isn't always better.
customer_reviews.author: Krista71

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately I must have gotten a bad batch of sorts? I applied topically per usual last week. It was the appropriate dose, the ointment touching the skin, we waited longer than 48 hours to bathe our dog again, all directions followed. I took my dog on a walk in the grass yesterday and 15 minutes after getting inside we found TWO tics on her, both alive and hooked into her flesh. The tics didn't even look ill, they moved around pretty quickly after being removed from our dog. I've never ran into an issue with this brand before, so I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't trust anything else
customer_reviews.text: After using Walmart brand flea and tick medicine and still finding ticks, never again. K9 Advantix 2 is great, I've never found a tick on my dog since using it. Great job repelling mosquitoes too, our dogs almost never get bit anymore. Very convenient to buy it in larger numbers, because with 2 dogs they go quickly. Much cheaper to buy from Amazon than at Petsmart!!
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Found a tick only 5 days after application.
customer_reviews.text: Well first of all, this product did not work!!! Not sure if this seller just got a hold of a diluted product, or the ticks in my area are super ticks. We followed the instructions. Applied it on a Tuesday and by that Sunday, she had a tick embedded and fully alive. The product says it “repels” but last time I checked, repelling implied keeping ticks away from my dog. Not happy with this purchase and wish it would have worked since we are expecting a bad year for ticks. Now I can’t use another tick medication for a month or more. Highly dissatisfied. I will not be buying any of this again.
customer_reviews.author: Alle Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT keep ticks off my dog
customer_reviews.text: This product kept the fleas off, but did nothing for ticks. I even went and bought the same thing from PetCo thinking this one may not be the real thing, but it didn’t work for my dog. He’s been on it for 2 months now, still gets ticks on him. Sooo disgusting. It’s also very pricey compared to FrontLine. Switching to FrontLine.
customer_reviews.author: sparker117

customer_reviews.title: Good brand, should have read it was only 4 doses
customer_reviews.text: I have bought this brand before. I like that it has tick, flea and mosquito protection. I thought I was getting this a bit cheaper than from another seller on Amazon I had purchased from before. I was wrong because for ten more dollars I could have gotten two more doses. I thought I was ordering a 6 dose packet, but it was only 4 doses. I will read description more carefully next time. I would still recommend this brand regardless.
customer_reviews.author: MsBunny

customer_reviews.title: Not sure this is an authentic product
customer_reviews.text: I am somewhat suspicious as to whether this is authentic K9 Advantix as I have never had a problem with the doses I've purchased from my vet, but within two weeks off applying this version from amazon, my dog was scratching and I found fleas on her. I tried another dose and she is still itching. Guess I will have to go back to the vet for the real stuff.
customer_reviews.author: clridenhour

customer_reviews.title: Not useful if you go into actual woods with a fluffy dog
customer_reviews.text: Used the product as directed. Right down to the skin on all 3 dogs. Making sure to part all their fur/hair. After using, we went through some wooded areas. My short haired boys didnt get any, it would be easy to see those if they did. But, with our majestic, thick furred beauty, I found 6 ticks embedded in her. What's the point of using this stuff if it doesnt actually work on the Mother Fluffer?
customer_reviews.author: RN Davis

customer_reviews.title: It DOES repel!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our Australian Shepherd who hikes with me weekly. Dog always had 5 - 10 ticks after the hike. Used this as it is applied externally and that it is supposed to be a repellent too. Same hike, in same areas, no ticks. Found one flea on her foot dancing around like it did not like where it was. Like the external applied prevention as have concern about dog consuming other types.
customer_reviews.author: MKS

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Didn't do anything! Used this on my two doggos, and assumed it was doing it's job. It has the best reviews at an affordable price. Here we are two weeks later, and I notice my dogs are scratching quite a bit... I check, and sure enough, they are covered in fleas. In fact, this is probably the worst batch of flea prevention I've ever used. I'm used to finding one or two fleas on my pets despite monthly treatments, but I have literally never seen so many fleas on them before. Do not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CKR

customer_reviews.title: Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: We live in Tennessee and have a bad flea, tick, mosquito problem. We tried everything and nothing worked till we used this product. We purchased the large dog size to split between 2 dogs, because that is all we can afford. This will last 6 months for both dogs. We were very worried about our pups getting sick, but they had no reaction, which I was so happy, since my one pup is allergic to fleas. I highly recommend this product, because it really works. Make sure you purchase Earthbath shampoo, since it does not wash off the treatment or any other shampoo that will not affect the treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa G

customer_reviews.title: Product didn't completely work on first dose.
customer_reviews.text: Our Black Mouth Cur had fleas when we adopted her. We used the first dose on her. It killed the adult fleas and got rid of them. We took her to the vet for a checkup. Turns out she is pregnant. We decided not to abort the puppies. About two weeks later our dog had fleas again. We called the vet. It was suggested that we give the second dose of the K9 Advantix II after the third week. We did so and the fleas are again gone. 4 weeks later and she had 10 puppies. No fleas on mama or babies. This product is still working. The puppies are now 6 weeks old and healthy. And, flea free.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: 4 dogs. Didn't work on any of them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 4 dog's. Put it on all of them at the same time. All of them run outside and go potty first thing in the morning. They all run back in and all 4 of their heads are down chomping at some itch. Then run over to eat breakfast and while 2 are enjoying themselves the other 2 are scratching themselves into oblivion while waiting their turn. Then repeat. Bottom line. Doesn't work. Lol Seresto flea and tick collars it is again.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy York

customer_reviews.title: I should have just started a fire with the money that I wasted on this product at least I would have got ...
customer_reviews.text: The prouduct was expired I have 4 large dogs so the package i chose was one month for me! It did nothing for the fleas or anything! Im going back to 1-800PETMEDS where they check there products expiration! I should have just started a fire with the money that I wasted on this product at least I would have got something out of it Meanwhile my dogs are still got freaking fleas! They got enough fleas to start a circus and that's a circus I don't want to visit.
customer_reviews.author: CLYDE Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Has been working for years.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for both of my boys! Worked in Congo where fleas and ticks are vicious. Totally recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Deedra

customer_reviews.title: This Products id Efffective
customer_reviews.text: This product has been working better than Soresto for us. I find only a couple of fleas on my dog on occasion since we started using this product last month. I would recommend this product if the cheaper Soresto doesn't work for you. I don't like that I can't bathe my dog as often as I'd like to and I don't like that the instructions first state to dispose of the waste carefully, as stated below... and after most other information, says to essentially just throw it away like any other garbage. Just state that from the beginning, maybe?
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie M.

customer_reviews.title: Killed MOST live bugs:(
customer_reviews.text: In all fairness my dog is a very long haired husky and he was already infested with fleas. I’ve vacuumed the carpets but not enough obviously, I also failed to give him a flea bath before applying the product. If I would’ve done it in this order I’ve been told a better result would happen. I also bought a flea comb and used it before the medicine but I should’ve also washed him and just the come again before the treatment. However my dog has stopped trying to be himself at all times and I really can’t see any of them today I just know it’s itchy from time to time
customer_reviews.author: kellysenn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My Dogs
customer_reviews.text: This year is a bad year for Eastern equine encephalitis in our state, with another mosquito-borne illness (can't remember name) so I switched from another well known brand to this one for the mosquito repellent. Amazon is MUCH cheaper than my vet's office, and also cheaper than my local pet food store. I understand this is because there are only two in the package instead of three, but I have two dogs so this is perfect. No more trying to remember where I put the extra one, or do I need to get another package?
customer_reviews.author: MadeupaginTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Don't Combine Order With 2nd Heavy Item(s)
customer_reviews.text: Items that were shipped in a single Brown outer box included: Hill's Dog Food, 35 lb Bag ( in a Box) Bayer K9 Advantix II Flea, Tick for XLarge Dogs, 6 doses Bayer K9 Advantix II Flea, Tick for Large Dogs, 6 doses Smaller boxes of Flea meds protected from larger 35 pound bag (in a box) of dog food by single piece of brown paper approximately 2 feet long. Flea meds arrived in CRUSHED boxes. Not sure if the Flea med tubes broke open as they are in sealed foil envelopes. See Attached Picture.
customer_reviews.author: R. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: I get this sent to me monthly for my two dogs with the subscribe and save and I love it. It’s cheaper than buying it at the store, I’ve never had any issues with fleas or ticks, and I don’t have to worry about remembering it every month, because it gets sent to me automatically. The odor isn’t too strong and both my dogs tolerate it very well! It also doesn’t make too much of a mess either which I appreciate. I’ve had cheaper flea and tick medicines that stank to high heaven and seemed to make half of their backs a wet, goopy mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Shealy

customer_reviews.title: made my 42lb cog sick
customer_reviews.text: easy to apply like all the others, my dog was not himself for about 4 days, did not want to do anything. first time using this product. i just say use at your discretion.... dog is back to normal, did not throw up but had diarhea for 3 days, this was the only thing different that we did with him, so we know it was this treatment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wow! No ticks at all!
customer_reviews.text: We went to Nh this past weekend now my dogs have had this one for over a month now. My brothers dog who has a different collar brand on we found 6 ticks on him. Granted they were falling off but gross! Who wants to have that in their house!!! My two came in from the same yard with nothing not one tick!! To say I’m shocked and happy is an understatement. My two are 50-55lbs very active pups. So rolling in the grass to playing where I just wish they wouldn’t in tall grass. So far so good no ticks on them at all.
customer_reviews.author: lauren kane

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a few other brands and they did not work well for my dogs. They would get burns or rashes on their neck. My vet suggested to try Bayer as it is a lot gentler while still being effective. He was totally right, it works so well for both of my dogs! I have used this for almost 2 years now and have never seen a single flea or tick on both of my dogs. This stuff is really amazing. Bottom line - if you have had issues with other brands try Bayer out, it is great. I hope this review helps!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work. Went through the whole 6 pack in 3 weeks on our puppies. They kept going in to the vet for puppy visits k shots, exams, worming...) and every time the vet checked and said they had fines. Every week they got a bath, and another tube of this. Still the fleas. Switched to Advantage 2, no more fleas. Think the fleas in South Carolina must be immune to this crap. Don't waste your money on this. Just buy Advantage 2 instead!
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaGirly

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and it works
customer_reviews.text: We applied puppy's first application on May 1. On May 31 we went to visit my dad in the rural country. We went on a walk through the woods, and I know I picked off at least 20 ticks climbing my leg then 3 more that night that I had missed. I was worried about my dog, so on June 1 we applied his 2nd application. On June 2, I found 3 dead ticks on him. They were still attached, but they were most certainly dead. I've never seen a flea on him, or in my house.
customer_reviews.author: J. P. Kuntz

customer_reviews.title: Works but don't take the risk!!
customer_reviews.text: I used to be loyal to this product and I will admit it DOES work well, but the most recent time I applied it to my dog, I thought he was going to die. He was shaking and panting, I almost took him to the vet. If you do your research online you will read about hundreds of dogs dying from this product! What the..?@!? I would recommend something less harsh, especially if you have a puppy or an older dog like mine which may be more sensitive to topical products. This is probably the most harsh flea prevention medication on the market. Two vets we've been to say they would never recommend this particular product due to the dangers.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S

customer_reviews.title: Use with caution
customer_reviews.text: I tried this product for my dog for the first time since Frontline had stopped working. Big mistake. About 3 days later, he had twitching and spasms on his back in every location the medication had been placed, and his back muscles were rigid. I washed him as soon as I noticed the symptoms. The product has neurotoxins in it, and looking up reviews online, there are many complaints from owners with similar problems and even worse. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: A Doc

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work. Better price on here than petstores
customer_reviews.text: My mom recommended this. She uses on her rottweilers and Yorkie poos. I use it every month and a half on my 55ish lbs boxer mix. He has never had fleas and only seen one or two ticks on him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Test your dog before applying! But keeps the bugs off
customer_reviews.text: I would rate this higher, but my dog had a pretty severe reaction to this product and it took 2 months/applications and HUNDREDS of dollars in vet visits to finally figure out what was wrong with her. Her reactions included skin irritation to the point of scratching/gnawing her skin raw and ripping chunks of fur out. And the biggest and worst reaction was vomiting almost every day for almost two months! Ultrasounds and x rays and blood work and the most expensive dog food in the world... and it was only a reaction to the flea/tick treatment
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McCuen

customer_reviews.title: I don't feel like this product should be so easy to buy without ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is POISON! It made my dog vomit and have diarrhea. Some of it got on my hands and face. For 2 days I've had a burning sensation as if I rubbed Ben Gay all over the place. I gave my dog a bath in Dawn to remove it from his coat and skin. I don't feel like this product should be so easy to buy without a prescription and warning from a vet.
customer_reviews.author: Tcc

customer_reviews.title: Stray puppies covered in ticks!
customer_reviews.text: We found 2 stray puppies and brought them in our home to get them out of the 110 degree heat. Little did we know, they had hundreds of teeny ticks on them. I immediately panicked because my dogs (who use a prescription treatment) were not able to get to the vet for a refill of their flea/tick meds until a week later. I did some quick research and ordered this for the strays AND our dogs. Its magic, this stuff. Within 3 days the little Male pup who had them the worst was already almost free of the nasty little creatures!
customer_reviews.author: Sara C

customer_reviews.title: OMG It Worked!
customer_reviews.text: My two dogs picked up fleas at grandma’s so I decided to give this a try. It’s the ONLY flea killer that has EVER worked on them! They’re no longer itching! Seriously, if you have a flea infestation get this treatment! It will save your dogs and kill all those pesky fleas! So worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Aria

customer_reviews.title: Best flea meds around!
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed when I opened the box to find my product was opened already... the box the doses come in was ripped open, and the monthly dose trackers were missing.... each dose is individually packaged, so I was comfortable with using the product...however, if they had not been I would have returned because of the package.... other than that, the Meds are great....I use them monthly on our 2 Boston terriers!
customer_reviews.author: tucksMAMA

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I have generally stuck with advantage and other big brand names that have stood the test of time. I don't know how long these have been around but I'd never heard of them until recently but they work just as awesome. Haven't had any issues. Even at the end of the month when it's time to reapply it still seems to be working well. And it seems to always be a little cheaper than the other brands that also work well which is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: watch out
customer_reviews.text: our dog is on the smaller side (23 lb) for the large dog dosage, and she becomes very inactive and would not move for the whole day after we apply it on her back. We suspect the dosage is too strong for her size. Since the product is offered at such wide range of dog sizes, the company should package it in smaller sized containers where there is option for owner to apply the appropriate amount for their fur-friend. Buyer be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Trani

customer_reviews.title: Odorless and Effective
customer_reviews.text: We used to use Hartz (which I believe is discontinued) and it smelled so bad. A lot of Flea and Tick treatments smell like pesticides and are not good for your pet or your home. Our dogs used to run around like crazy and rub their bodies everywhere as if to get the product off. K9 Advantix is odorless and doesn't seem to bother them at all. they have absolutely no issues with fleas, ticks, or mosquitos when we use this and we live in an area where there is a lot of tall grass and wildlife. Very happy with this product and the price is reasonable in comparison to super expensive vet brands.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ferdinand

customer_reviews.title: I had heard that k9 advantix was one of the better known brands that work well for killing and preventing ...
customer_reviews.text: Near end of summer I had noticed 1 flea on my dog who only uses the backyard. I had heard that k9 advantix was one of the better known brands that work well for killing and preventing fleas. 1st dose I have to my dog and waited about a week to really review the first round. My dog had been attacked by fleas. More fleas and bites. This medication did nothing. Waited until 2nd dose.. again NOTHING. I've had to give the dog baths to help soothe his skin and at least attempt to aid this medication. This medication has not worked AT ALL. Waste of $$$.
customer_reviews.author: alexandria capra

customer_reviews.title: Best product on the market for protecting your dog
customer_reviews.text: Although he wears a flea collar my dog picked up some fleas. I started with some natural products with peppermint oil and even used a flea comb, nothing worked. After applying K9 advantix I noticed a change within 4 hours. By the next morning 99% of the infestation was gone and by the end of the day completely FLEA-FREE !! Definitely worth the money ! After 30 years of owning dogs this is the best treatment I've ever found.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Burned my dog
customer_reviews.text: This burned my dog! She has a giant scab where I put the medication. I am furious
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!! Chemical burns and skin issues for our poor pups! HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product negative stars, I would. This gave our dogs the WORST skin issues. Our older dog ended up with chemical burns that made her lose almost al of her hair and she was in so much pain. They also ended up with severely dry skin after! It was horrible. I wish I could return it or get a refund bc this product is dangerous. No one should have to deal with this for their pets. The vet was not happy about it and we will never recommend it to anyone ever!!!! Amazon- please take this off your site!
customer_reviews.author: JayMichelle

customer_reviews.title: works
customer_reviews.text: our dog got lyme as did I. Our dog is a tic magnet so we were recommended by the vet to use Advantix k9 as well the advantix collar at the same time as extra protection. We were very concerned with what this poison would do to our dog but the Lyme almost killed her so we had to try. No more tics on her or dragged into the house, No ill effects so far after 1.5 years. We do stop the K9 in the winter months but keep the collar on year round. We had used frontline prior and would find tics on her still as well as alive in the house after falling off her.
customer_reviews.author: bmwm1

customer_reviews.title: It's OK I guess
customer_reviews.text: This product has worked for my dog for years, although I worry about the toxicity. I usually stopped during the Northeast winter month, but got a warm spell and an infestation brewed. One application did not work, so had to wait another week to apply, meanwhile washing and vacuuming everything everyday. After the 2nd application everything was fine for about 8 days, then fleas appeared again. The indoor cats who don't get treated and got first case of fleas from the dog's infestation received 1 dose of Bayer Advantage II or advecta II and they are still clean after 16 days. I guess this just doesn't work on my dog anymore??? Going to try something else.
customer_reviews.author: rmy

customer_reviews.title: Try frontline
customer_reviews.text: I really don't know what happened with this product. I had ordered it previously, and it was effective. This last one I got did not do anything. I applied as I usually do, following the directions, 3 days later, both my dogs still have fleas. A week later, they still have fleas. I ordered the large dog and small dog. I tried another flea medication, front line, and fleas are gone. I will not be ordering this again.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Bond

customer_reviews.title: Waiting to see if this product is genuine and actually works after reading other reviews
customer_reviews.text: Switched to Bayer K9 Advantix but concerned product shipped from Amazon supplier will be genuine. No way to test the product other that applying it and watching dogs response. To this point have noticed a very heightened sense of 'excitability' in both dogs for several hours after applying the recommended dosage - hopefully not some Chinese cocktail of toxic ingredients in a counterfeit Bayer package..... time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: mk

customer_reviews.title: Still have fleas, seems to being keeping ticks off
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two boxes the large for my Pitt and small for my daschund and I couldn’t be more disappointed did not work at all for either one, I haven’t seen any reduction in fleas, I haven’t seen any ticks on them but not working at all on the fleas. I gave them both capstar to kill all their fleas the day before I used this product a couple of days later and it was like I never applied it. Pretty disappointed considering the price. I’ve used advantix before and it worked great. Sad
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Mommy

customer_reviews.title: works great and safe for my older pets
customer_reviews.text: I took my golden retriever and cat off oral pills for fleas ticks because the pills cause my golden to have a seizure and my cat made him sick after i got them out of the vet she recommended a topical for safety and i have been using this for my golden who is 8 yrs old w heart failure and it works great and doesnt cause side effects. yea. my cat takes revolution topical and she is 18.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeypony

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply.
customer_reviews.text: This has always worked well for us in the past, but this has been a horrible year. We have done two treatments now, and still seeing a few fleas here and there. I'm hearing the same from everyone this year, that they are nearly impossible to get rid of. I'm guessing one more treatment next month should have them all knocked out. Super easily to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: My dog was having trouble with flies biting her ears. No flea or tick problems but thought this would be worth a try. Very pleased so far. Flies are staying away, even after a bath, giving her ears a chance to heal. I will be using this again next summer as a preventative. Costly but more effective than the daily attention i was giving to treat her ears before using this.
customer_reviews.author: janie

customer_reviews.title: No effect on fleas.
customer_reviews.text: This product had no effect on either of my two dogs. I had high hopes for this product since it's made by Bayer, the same company that makes Advantage 2; which is a product that with which I've had good luck. Unfortunately, the Advantix 2 did absolutely nothing to help kill the fleas on my dogs. I just received a box of Advantage 2 and have treated my dogs today. I feel like I wasted time and money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Longwell

customer_reviews.title: Trusted for my FOUR dogs!
customer_reviews.text: I use this on all FOUR of my dogs and have for years. It gets the job done. Easy to use! Doesn't bother them or their skin. So far, so good and no fleas or ticks! I recommend using this several days before or after any bath or grooming and avoid them being in rain or swimming after application or at least 24-48 hours to ensure proper absorption into the skin!
customer_reviews.author: Aimcat

customer_reviews.title: Best medication to prevent fleas & ticks ESPECIALLY mosquitoes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Every year that my dogs are tested for heartworm we are told our dogs are heartworm free!!! However to prevent heartworm with this med you must use it year round. There is always a chance that there is a pesky mosquito in the house surviving the winter. It is somewhat pricey but for a good reason. We live in New Hampshire and i have 6 rescue dogs!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product
customer_reviews.text: I put these on my dog as preventative treatment because I noticed she was scratching and biting..... after applying this medication I noticed an enormous amount of hair being shed from her to the point that I thought she had mange! After looking her over I discovered an actual bloody scabbed hole in her skin where I applied this flea/tick treatment! I would never recommend this or use it again!
customer_reviews.author: CaRaaa21

customer_reviews.title: Old product unsure of its origins
customer_reviews.text: Very old packaging dated 2017, the box was dried out and open when I received and the package was Stamped NOT FOR RESALE. Very concerned about using this on my dog and I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: mazd1970

customer_reviews.title: Killed ZERO fleas.
customer_reviews.text: My dog’s Seresto collar stopped working in a short amount of time, and I began to see fleas on him. I tossed the collar and bought this Advantix. It did absolutely nothing. The flea infestation actually worsened over time and after about a week I had to take him in to the vet for the oral product. This purchase was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Formula works  and easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this a few months now as prevention. It gets rid of all the infestations listed and deters them I worked as a Veterinary Technician and use to use Frontline this Advantix I believe is a much better formula. Ticks fleas cause horrible illnesses put this on every 30 days and save your dog's from misery . Also deters mosquitos flies and lice . I say yes don't skip in the winter do 12 months a year.
customer_reviews.author: Erin H.

customer_reviews.title: Opened box!
customer_reviews.text: Why is my box open?? The shipping box was intact but the box the product came in was open! The seals seem n tact in the foil but I have heard these can be opened and resealed as well. Not sure if I should use it or not? And if it doesn’t work I’m going to believe it was tampered with so can I get a refund if that’s the case??
customer_reviews.author: IceKter

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t repel deer flies
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never used anything else because this is top rated by non biased reviews ( you have to be cautious about vet recommendations because most, not all vets, recommend brands who sponsor for selling/ promoting certain brands. There’s the negative of the harsh pesticides so be wary of small children and yourself for at least the first day of application and if your dog, like most, will try to “clean” the dose, DO NOT dose all the way down the back to butt area or areas they will ingest. Also, from outdoor and camping experience, it does not repel deer flies.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Kennedy and Todd Matthews

customer_reviews.title: Some dogs may have an adverse reaction
customer_reviews.text: I've used flea and tick preventative for years, but never Advatix II. I tried it this year and one of my dogs had a horribly adverse reaction with diarrhea for 3 days and vomiting. While trying to figure out what happened, I read the potential side effects. Unfortunately, she is one of those dogs. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you have cats too
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. This product can't be used if you have cats, too. According to the package it can kill your cats, even for 24 hrs after you apply it to your dog. I didn't know that, so I can't use it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Schobitz

customer_reviews.title: Open box
customer_reviews.text: Same product I have always used and liked. It seems to work well. Pretty large tube and runs easy. I ended up placing it pretty much completely down her back as 5 spots wasn't enough. However, the box arrived opened. I almost sent it back seeing as I don't want to use opened medication on my dog. But the individual doses are sealed and I needed it immediately, so I kept it. Still, disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: AMME

customer_reviews.title: Made no difference
customer_reviews.text: Our Welshie was scratching. We applied the Advantix II, no change. Maybe it's something else but the vet said she would itch less if she maintained a flea preventive schedule. I'm disappointed but who knows, maybe she's just allergic even though the itchiness is in all the traditional flea scratching areas like collar and butt as opposed to feet which is known to be allergies.
customer_reviews.author: What's4dinner?

customer_reviews.title: My K9
customer_reviews.text: So, as for an overall review, I have no real complaints. The packaging normally comes damaged every month; but it's nothing that would stop me from actually using the product. In terms of taking care of those pest, it does a good job. However, it does have to be applied every month. If you are late applying the following months treatment, its at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Jeffers

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all!
customer_reviews.text: Maybe some people are lucky enough to see results from using this item but my experience is that 3 weeks after applying the first dose I saw fleas on my dog. I've been told by my vet that this type of remedy for fleas doesn't really work and that Nexguard is the only true and immediate remedy. Of course, Nexguard is only available from vets so read into that what you will. But if Nexguard works and Advantix doesn't then this is a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Sciarra

customer_reviews.title: Advantix used to work, but not now, at least for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this Bayer Advantix II regularly for a several years now, per the application instructions, on our three medium size dogs, and it seemed to work ok. But then recently all three got a bad flea infestation. I applied the Advantix immediately upon noticing, and it gave relief for maybe a day. But within a week the fleas were back. I tried reapplying the Advantix again, then again in another week, but no effect on the fleas. Finally took the dogs to the vet, he prescribed an oral medication that got rid of all the fleas within days. Vet mentioned something about Advantix being re-formulated and no longer effective.
customer_reviews.author: Drew52

customer_reviews.title: cannot use again
customer_reviews.text: I have always used the Bravecto for my French Bulldog and haven't had any problems. I applied this per directions and it did burn my dogs skin. I will not be using the rest of the 3 doses.
customer_reviews.author: LDS

customer_reviews.title: Every dog had a reaction.
customer_reviews.text: I have 11 dogs. An American Bully, a Dachshund, and 9 Chihuahua's (2 are fostered for a local rescue). I used this product on all of the dogs. EACH dog has had horrible itching at the application site, even after bathing with a soothing shampoo 2 days after application. I have heard to never use the one mfg in France, this one was mfg in Germany. Not sure if the "cure" is worth it. I may have to switch to Frontline.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the ticks away but leaves a greasy residue on fur
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works well at keeping ticks away, and ultimately that is what matters most for keeping Fido safe. It is quite expensive for what it is though, Also after applying it, the dog has a greasy strip of fur where it has been applied, no matter how carefully it is applied to skin only and not on the fur itself. This goes away within a day or two though and the protection remains.
customer_reviews.author: TechGuyInBoston

customer_reviews.title: Advantix II
customer_reviews.text: Advantix II. Purchased for my 50 lb American Bulldog. She has been getting a lot of ticks lately and was recently on Bravecto, which stops working. She was in her 3 month of Bravecto and the product was not working as it should have been. Vet advised us what we should try since other flea/tick meds was not working. We have tried this only for one month and have not seen any ticks. She still goes out and in as she did in the past. Seems this is working better than the other. Happy with the purchase so far. Only thing I like with the other is that it is pill form and this is liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: This ate the leather on our couch!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how it works for fleas, but last night we applied this to our dogs. This morning we notices strange spots on our leather couch. After inspecting we realized the spots were roughly 4 inches apartz and in horizontal rows, exactly how it was applied on our dogs. We have used Frontline in the past and never had this issue. Now our couch is ruined!!
customer_reviews.author: byronh0527

customer_reviews.title: Highly effective. immediate action.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works and it works fast. As I applied it I could see the fleas litterally stopping DEAD in their tracks while trying to run for the hills. I was a bit concerned about applying it because I realized that I had ordered one size to big for my dogs but they were just fine. Albeit they seemed to be even more itchy immediately after the application and for the next few days but I will definitely be using this product in the future. Highly recommended. Take that fleas in yo face. 😈 🐜💣💥
customer_reviews.author: Jamilla Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Beware, Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: Beware!!! I bought this product for my dog (65 lbs) and it left a open sore on her back along where I applied this!!!! Do NOT buy from this place, I have never had this happen before!! Also bought one for my other dog who is 6 lbs (one for 4 - 10lbd dogs) from this same Co. and same thing happened to him!! Bad products or bad batchs!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best stuff on the market
customer_reviews.text: I won’t buy any other type of flea/tick treatment, I have been using this for years and it’s the only thing that helped get rid of a flea infestation years ago. I bring my dog hiking through the woods and used to always get ticks, after using this stuff I very rarely ever see one. And when I do, it’s crawling around and has not bitten yet (they should die and fall off if they do bite) this is the only product I trust for my purebred husky.
customer_reviews.author: Denis B.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended to use this by someone who said iwas good. I gave my dog a bath he had maybe 2 fleas. I used this and the dog goes out and plays in the yard. Now 3 days later he is covered in fleas!!!!! I can literally pick them off of him! I just wasted my money on a 4 month supply on something that doesn't work!
customer_reviews.author: gabrielle chenail

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on ticks in PA.
customer_reviews.text: Gave our dog a bath with flea/tick shampoo. Smells great with hint of clove and cinnamon(natural repellents). Applied this treatment according to directions. Our dog is on the smaller side of the weight spectrum. Found a feeding tick on them within an inch of the residue, which is a little thick/and sticky after application. The ruffled area was where tick was removed from.
customer_reviews.author: JTHouse

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: After having a mishap where the product was empty upon receipt, the replacement arrived and performed great. My boston terrier/blue heeler mix did not seem to suffer any ill effects after application.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy H

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: We have used this in the past for our two Australian Shepherds and it's been great. Easy to apply (once we can get through their thick long hair), doesn't drip, and we haven't had any issues with fleas and ticks to date. We use the subscribe and save option and this seems pretty reasonable considering the cost of some other flea and tick preventatives.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Just did not work at all
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product in the past that I purchased several times in a local pet store. The product worked well. I decided to save time and but it here on line. I must have gotten one of the counterfeit packages you so often read about. It did not work at all. Not even a little bit. I had been warned by my vet to stay away from online sellers because this is a commonly counterfeited item or sold grossly out of date. In the future I won't take this chance again.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan Diffley

customer_reviews.title: Better protection in the South
customer_reviews.text: We have had our dog friendlies shifting resistances in the past few years, and this has been the one that seems to work the best. Have had no issues with the standard parasites, so no qualms there. The only issue is the applicator can get a little out of control on application and end up all over your hands. Some caution or a redesign would be advised.
customer_reviews.author: Chris James

customer_reviews.title: A SURE WAY TO PROTECT YOUR DOG
customer_reviews.text: We have used ADVANTIX II on our present dog, a West Highland Terrier, for the past six years. In that time we have found 1 flea, DEAD !! That's good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Old Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Completely useless, didn’t help at all
customer_reviews.text: Did nothing for our dog. Fleas were so bad he developed a bad rash. Switched to a different oral medication and the fleas finally disappeared. Don’t waste your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Zimmer

customer_reviews.title: Great Collar That Works
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. I was skeptical about a collar really controlling ticks. We had a real problem in the spring. My vet recommended we try this collar. It was amazing. We went from the dog having 5or6 new ticks every time she went out to zero. The ticks she had fell off. It is an amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clinard

customer_reviews.title: HARMFUL! STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.text: Turned out to be more expensive than advertised. You think you're getting two months supply for less than 30$, but they dont tell you about these "hidden fees". What are these hidden fees you might ask? Let me tell yoy about that... k9-Advanti was used on my lab and three days later he developed little lumps all over his body, head, even inside his ears. After doses of benadryl and trying to wash off the medication the lumps havent went away, its been nearly three weeks. Time for a costly vet visit. Thanks alot, Bayer!!
customer_reviews.author: cody

product_meta.title: K9 Advantix II Flea, Tick and Mosquito Prevention for Large Dogs, 21 - 55 lbs
product_meta.description: Style:6 doses| Size:21-55 lbThe 6-pack of Bayer K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for large dogs is a broad-spectrum, veterinarian-recommended dog flea and tick prevention that also kills and repels mosquitoes, a benefit not found in many other flea and tick products. Some products require a flea or tick to bite your dog in order to work, but K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for dogs is a topical formula that works through contact, so your dog doesn’t have to endure a painful bite for the flea, tick or mosquito to die. Just one application of Bayer K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for large dogs starts working to kill fleas within 12 hours, is waterproof after 24 hours, and continues to work to kill fleas, ticks and mosquitoes for up to 30 days, even after a bath or swimming. We recommend the use of a grooming shampoo designed specifically for pets. Do not use K9 Advantix II on cats. Use only on dogs.
feature_bullets: 6 monthly applications of K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for large dogs weighing 21-55 pounds
K9 Advantix II flea and tick prevention for dogs works through contact, so fleas, ticks and mosquitoes do not have to bite your dog to die
K9 Advantix II flea and tick control for dogs is an easy to apply topical formula
Starts working to kill fleas within 12 hours and keeps working for 30 days
Suitable for effective year-round dog flea and tick treatment for large dogs
